Rich  et al-
	The design is too "modern" to be a fighting tsuba in my opinion, so  
it has to be Edo period, the gold chasing is a bit roughly done to my  
eye, which either means later work or lesser skill. I think later,  
like 1750 on and some school outside Edo as this was likely on the  
sword of someone more concerned with fashion. If I knew any schools  
I'd name one but...
-t
